cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida and 50 miles NNW of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest then turning north-northwest while paralleling the Florida east coast, later aiming toward the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the east-central Florida coast between Boca Raton and Cape Canaveral

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River (Gulf Coast of FL)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Boca Raton northward, extending up the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts possible with sustained tropical-storm to category-3 winds as the eyewall skirts the coast; 50-kt wind probability 65%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 4–6 ft above ground possible for Boca Raton to Sebastian Inlet, including the Port of Palm Beach area
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches likely with locally higher amounts up to 12 inches, producing flooding in low-lying port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, potential isolated tornadoes, and rapid water-level rise in the Intracoastal Waterway that could hamper port operations
